question_stem.en: A 30-year-old man comes to the emergency department due to rapidly increasing abdominal distention and anorexia. The patient has a history of HIV infection and intravenous drug use. CT scan of the abdomen shows ascites and a large mass involving the small intestine. Biopsy of the mass reveals sheets of uniform, round, medium-sized tumor cells with basophilic cytoplasm and a very high rate of proliferation and apoptosis. {{exhibit_1}}
question_stem.zh: 一名30岁男性因腹胀迅速加重和食欲不振来到急诊科。患者有HIV感染史和静脉注射毒品史。腹部CT扫描显示腹水和累及小肠的大肿块。肿块活检显示均匀、圆形、中等大小的肿瘤细胞片，具有嗜碱性细胞质，增殖和凋亡率非常高。{{exhibit_1}}

question.en: Which of the following infectious agents is most closely associated with the development of this patient's condition?
question.zh: 以下哪种病原体与该患者病情的发生最相关？

explanation.en:
This patient with rapidly increasing abdominal distention and abdominal mass has histopathology consistent with Burkitt lymphoma (BL), an aggressive B-cell malignancy. Epstein-Barr virus (EBV) is the infectious agent most strongly associated with BL pathogenesis.

EBV infects B cells via the CD21 complement receptor. Infected cells produce viral proteins that stimulate signaling pathways (eg, JAK/STAT), triggering proliferation. This proliferation of infected B cells is usually limited by T cells, but some B cells may reduce production of EBV antigens and escape recognition. An impaired immune response (eg, HIV, persistent malaria) can also enable continuous B-cell division. Proliferating B cells are more likely to acquire genetic abnormalities (eg, chromosomal translocations), resulting in a neoplastic clone. BL cells harbor the translocation t(8;14), which causes MYC overexpression, uncontrolled cell growth, and rapid enlargement.

Nondendemic BL often involves the gastrointestinal tract, which can present as an enlarging abdominal mass with ascites (due to lymph obstruction) and distention. Histopathology shows uniform, medium-sized lymphoid cells with basophilic cytoplasm and numerous mitotic figures (indicating high proliferation rate) and apoptotic bodies. Scattered macrophages, which digest the apoptotic debris, produce the characteristic "starry sky" appearance. {{exhibit_2}}

(Choice B) Helicobacter pylori is associated with gastric lymphoma (eg, marginal zone lymphoma of mucosa-associated lymphoid tissue [ie, MALT lymphoma]). Gastrointestinal MALT lymphomas may cause abdominal discomfort but are typically indolent and slow growing (ie, would have lower proliferation rate). Rapid abdominal distention would be unusual.

(Choice C) Chronic hepatitis B can cause hepatocellular carcinoma. Although patients may have abdominal distention and ascites, imaging would reveal a liver mass, not an intestinal lesion. Histopathology often shows thickened plates of malignant hepatocytes (eg, polygonal cells, eosinophilic cytoplasm).

(Choice D) Human herpesvirus 8 can cause Kaposi sarcoma (KS), a vascular tumor seen in HIV-positive individuals. Although it can involve the gastrointestinal tract in later stages, KS typically presents initially with cutaneous lesions. Histopathology often shows spindle-shaped endothelial cells and slit-like vascular spaces.

(Choice E) High-risk human papillomavirus types (eg, 16, 18) have been identified in cervical squamous cell carcinoma. Histopathology often shows invasive nests of malignant cells with squamous differentiation (eg, intercellular bridges).

Educational objective:
Burkitt lymphoma, an aggressive B-cell malignancy, can be associated with Epstein-Barr virus infection. It typically presents as a rapidly growing mass (eg, abdomen). Histopathology shows sheets of uniform, medium-sized lymphoid cells with numerous mitotic figures (ie, high proliferation rate) and apoptotic bodies. {{exhibit_3}} {{exhibit_4}}
explanation.zh:
该患者腹胀迅速加重且腹部出现肿块，其组织病理学与伯基特淋巴瘤 (BL) 相符，这是一种侵袭性B细胞恶性肿瘤。EB病毒 (EBV) 是与BL发病机制最密切相关的病原体。

EBV通过CD21补体受体感染B细胞。感染细胞产生病毒蛋白，刺激信号通路（例如，JAK/STAT），从而触发增殖。这种被感染的B细胞的增殖通常受到T细胞的限制，但一些B细胞可能会减少EBV抗原的产生并逃避免疫系统的识别。免疫反应受损（例如，HIV、持续性疟疾）也可以促进B细胞的持续分裂。增殖的B细胞更容易获得遗传异常（例如，染色体易位），从而导致肿瘤克隆。BL细胞携带t(8;14)易位，导致MYC过度表达、细胞不受控制的生长和快速增大。

非地方性BL通常累及胃肠道，可表现为腹胀伴腹水（由于淋巴管阻塞）和扩张。组织病理学显示均匀、中等大小的淋巴细胞，具有嗜碱性细胞质和许多有丝分裂象（表明高增殖率）和凋亡小体。散在的巨噬细胞，消化凋亡碎片，产生特征性的“星空”外观。{{exhibit_2}}

（选项B）幽门螺杆菌与胃淋巴瘤（例如，黏膜相关淋巴组织边缘区淋巴瘤 [即，MALT淋巴瘤]）相关。胃肠道MALT淋巴瘤可能引起腹部不适，但通常是惰性的、生长缓慢的（即，增殖率较低）。快速腹胀是不常见的。

（选项C）慢性乙型肝炎可引起肝细胞癌。尽管患者可能出现腹胀和腹水，但影像学检查会显示肝脏肿块，而不是肠道病变。组织病理学通常显示恶性肝细胞增厚的板（例如，多边形细胞，嗜酸性细胞质）。

（选项D）人类疱疹病毒8型可引起卡波西肉瘤 (KS)，这是一种在HIV阳性个体中可见的血管肿瘤。尽管它可以在晚期累及胃肠道，但KS通常最初表现为皮肤病变。组织病理学通常显示梭形内皮细胞和裂隙状血管腔。

（选项E）在高危人乳头瘤病毒类型（例如，16、18）已被发现在宫颈鳞状细胞癌中。组织病理学通常显示具有鳞状分化的恶性细胞浸润巢（例如，细胞间桥）。

教育目标：
伯基特淋巴瘤，一种侵袭性B细胞恶性肿瘤，可能与EB病毒感染有关。它通常表现为快速生长的肿块（例如，腹部）。组织病理学显示均匀、中等大小的淋巴细胞片，具有许多有丝分裂象（即，高增殖率）和凋亡小体。{{exhibit_3}} {{exhibit_4}}

summary.en:
This question tests knowledge of Burkitt lymphoma, its association with Epstein-Barr virus (EBV), and its characteristic histopathological features. It also requires differentiating Burkitt lymphoma from other conditions associated with abdominal masses and ascites.

To solve this question, recognize the clinical presentation of rapidly increasing abdominal distention in an HIV-positive patient, along with the histopathological description of uniform, medium-sized tumor cells with basophilic cytoplasm and high proliferation rate. Recall that Burkitt lymphoma is strongly associated with EBV, especially in immunocompromised individuals.
summary.zh:
此题考察了对伯基特淋巴瘤、其与EB病毒 (EBV) 的关联及其特征性组织病理学特征的了解。还需要将伯基特淋巴瘤与其他与腹部肿块和腹水相关的疾病区分开来。

要解决这个问题，需要识别HIV阳性患者腹胀迅速加重的临床表现，以及均匀、中等大小的肿瘤细胞，具有嗜碱性细胞质和高增殖率的组织病理学描述。回想一下，伯基特淋巴瘤与EBV密切相关，尤其是在免疫功能低下的个体中。
